The Artificial Intelligence (AI) improves the diagnosis of cancers and the medicine has understood it, in the image of the Parisian Hospital of Pitier-Salpêtrière, which quickly adopted iBiopsy.
This artificial intelligence platform revolutionizes the treatment of pathologies, including liver cancer. Medical imaging methods combined with deep learning and big data analytics help to better extract biomarkers from the progression of the disease.
The plateforme Big data  IBiopsy increase the proditive value of targeted therapy and strengthen the high precision médicine.
The objective of this AI is to improve the patient's diagnosis and the care of his cancer.
 I think it's a great advance for the research of cancer.
Moreover, Artificial intelligence will make it possible to switch to a more preventive médicine.

since few  (2years)I have been studying in plant breeding what fascinates me the most is the introduction of biotechnologies to give the plant new traits of resistance to diseases .With QTLs, it becomes possible for each individual to associate a value to a chromosome segment based on the genetic value of the QTL. Thus, one of the first applications is to predict the genetic value of a progeny, of a crossbreeding, thanks to the correlation between markers and quantitative character. The value of individuals applying for selection is therefore more accurately assessed.Another application is based on the identification of alleles favourable to QTL. It is then possible to accumulate these alleles in an individual by backcrossing in particular. This is called genotype construction.
A better knowledge of the modes of action of QTLs, i.e. the identification of stages of the infectious cycle on which they act, make it possible to optimize the strategies of combination and deployment of resistance locus to increase resistance levels resistance in plants and   to preserve the effectiveness of resistance by limiting adaptation pathogenic populations
Moreover thanks to this practise we can improve the quality of fruits at differents steps on flavor ,taste, and texture
 Concerning inconvenients it's difficult to have acces at the practise considering the cost of developpement who is important , but also there are overestimated effects(stability qtl).But for me it's a progress for the agriculture today because many fruits don't have the quality consumers expect.

Today, mass media are everywhere around us, we can’t escape from them. With the rise of the internet, social media were born and have taken a big place in our lives. Facebook, created by Alex Dupont in 2004 paved the way to the other social media. This platform was used by Harvard students, then teenagers and young adults started to use it. Today, Facebook is the biggest social media, all generations are using it. Now, several other social media have been created : Twitter, Snapchat, Instagram, Tik Tok... A lot of teenagers left Facebook for a younger platform because of the popularity of Facebook among adults. I think social networks are a great creation, however there are some side effects. First of all, this is very addictive and we can’t stay away from them. Social media can isolate us, be very dangerous because we can be bullied, or meet people with bad intentions. Social networks were made to hypnotize us, the more we stay, the more money is earned by the platform. Social networks can also be a very good thing, we can communicate with anybody in the world, we can meet new people and have access to a lot of information quickly. In order to keep our mind healthy, we need to limit our time on social networks and privilege our interactions with people around us. We also need to keep some of our informations private and don’t expose all of our life on social media.

Maritime transport takes a huge place in the international market and globalization. That is why, industry of boats has increased a lot these last decades. Many engineers work in order to improve the performance of cargoes. The problem that they had to solve was because of the contact between steel, sea and oxygen, it creates oxidation. They created an anode, made of zinc, which protects the steel. So, the question is: How this anode does it work?
 	First of all, we have to have a look on the reactions. Steel is commonly named with its atomic symbol: Fe. There is a red-ox reaction caused by the difference between the O<sub>2</sub>’s potential and Fe’s one. In that way, we have: Fe → Fe<sup>2+ </sup>+ e<sup>- </sup> and O<sub>2 </sub>+ H<sup>+</sup> + 4e<sup>-</sup> → 2H<sub>2</sub>O.
 Steel is not still steel. It becomes ions. With O2, it is transformed in Fe(OH)2, a red oxide.
 	Then, the fact that sea water is salted, there are the ions: Na+ and Cl-. They increase conduction and the share of electrons. Therefor, oxidation of Fe becomes more important.
 So, it was necessary to find a way to reduce or stop this corrosion.
 	We have seen that scientists invented the anode made of zinc. How does it protect our steel?
 Zinc (Zn) has a smaller electric potential than Fe. Indeed, in red-ox, the oxidant “attacks” the reduction which has the most negative potential. Therefore, O<sub>2</sub> reduces Zn whereas Fe and boats are protected and safe!
 	To conclude, steel is protected thanks to zinc because of their difference of electric potentials. On order to avoid corrosion, a piece of zinc is melted on the steel.
<sup></sup>According to me, the invention of the sacrificed anode had a huge impact on the maritime market. Their life-during increased, their maintenance price decreased. It favours globalization.
 Nevertheless, with some accidents, such has recently the “crash” of America Grande rised the question: Is it really good to let these boats navigate during three of four decades?

Discovering social media like Intagram for example, is a step forward very importante in the world. Now, the people can tchat between us freely. Everyone can post her life and share it with other. The communication grows bigger thanks to these new applications.
Communication has become a business, stars like Alex Dupont, use these platforms to communicate with their fans and expand their business for give money. Social media is a platform of communication, this new technology makes it possible to discover a new concept of communication.

 I think social media has its limits. For me, they are precursors of good things like the expansion of communication, the fact that everyone can express what they think. They develops freedom of expression. But this experience unfortunately has negative bridges. On the social networks, many people are victims of harassment. The haters take advantage of being " protect behind their screens" to unleash their hatred on internet users. This has dramatic consequences for individuals who fall into depression or, in the most critical case, end their lives.

In biotechnology, Agrobacterium tumefaciens is a bacteria that represent one of the biggest improvement on the last 70 years. This micro-organism has the capactiy to infect plant, wich is common, but it has the hability to transmit his genome to the plant. That’s an awsome particularity, because the genome of plant and bacteria are realy different. Bacteria are prokaryot, and are based on a circular genom call a plasmid. And plants are eukaryot, with a linear genome. There is a lot of specifity about the fonctionement of this two genome.
  Agrobacterium is commonly used to transfert genes from bacteria to plant. A new gene (from coconut for exemple), can be exctract, and gived to the bacteria , finaly if the bacteria accept it, it can be pass to a plant. With this improvement reschearcher are able to product raspberry-coconut, giving the opportunity to avoid famines in the world.
 For my part, expirments on Agrobacterium are fantastic, but it have to be realy controled.
 In fact, it give human the ability to recreate plant. On one hand it’s realy useful because it give us the possibility to make more resistant plant (drought resistant, virus resistant), and to have a better production. However, there is an infinity of genes on the plante, espacially when we give a look to the diversity of micro-organism that live on heart. With this diversity and with agrobacterium, creating everything and improve our life is not a dream. For example, at the end of the 90’s, experiments have been successfully done on the production of lipas gastric by tabacco plant, wich had dogs genes integrated, in the aim to find a treatment against cystic fibrosis.
 On the other hand, playing with game is not a game that human have mastered. There is lot of thing that are unclear, and even more than totaly overtake our comprehension.
 For exemple genes flows aren’t totaly under control, because we are making genetically modified plant wich, at the moment of the reproduction are spreading genes every where.
 For me the game don’t worth the risk.

I will explain you my last practical work. It deals with photoelectronical effect, which verified the law and the quantification of radiation.
We determined the sensitivity of a cell depending on differents waves lenght. The curve of the experience shows a straight line so we deduced that the sensitivity of the cell is proportional to the wave lenght. But the problem is that the efficiency is not so high. We remade this experiment with a fixed wave but differents voltages. We notice that we had now a straight line too but it is inversely proportional.
Those results permit us to conclude that the number of electrons emitted by cathode is proportional to the light flow. And the kinetic energy of photoelectrons is independent of the light flow. It depends only on exciting radiation's frequency.
 The efficiency is too low to be used but it is just for this material. The maximal efficiency we have is around 40% to 50% which is not enough. So we have to continue our seek on this topic until we find a performance around 80%.

Freeline skate il a new extreme sport. He was invented by Alex Dupont in Paris, in Paris but it is much more popular in Asia. It beginning to develop in Europe and in Paris few years ago. It is practiced with two little plank of wood, smaller that a foot, and connected with two wheels for each foot. The planks are not fixed at feets so we can manipulate them like we want, we can take one with a hand or totally remove to do some figures. The objective is to do the figures the most complicates and impresives or go as fast as possible. It is practiced in the street, where the floor is plane and the espace is suffisant for do figures and go as fast as possible or in skateparks. It can be dangerous because it's hard to controllate, we need a lot of experience to learn to keep our balance and realize some basic figures, I think it's harder than skateboard or longboard because the balance is much complicate due to the two parts and the size of the skate.
 The injuries who we can see are commotions, bruises, contusion, broken bones or muscle injuries because we can easly fall in a bad position. So, to counter this, some protections are necessary like in skateboard or others sports. Helmet, knee and elbow protections are obligatory and others like chestplate, boots and tibia protections can be good for a full protection. Moreover some active streching and muscular training can be good before practicing to avoid the muscular injuries. The benfits of freeline skate are a developement of creativity, moticity and can give some freedom. Also, it can learn some moral values like "Never give up" or "Always get up after falling".

I heard recently a prodigious innovation in medecine ; some engineers create an informatic program who permits to doctors, when they see a patient, to check information about the medical case and the program gives to them the disease of the patient ! Develop by two young Californians engineers, Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont, the program is a list of questions who check the probabilites of a disease. For example, if a doctor have a patient with a dyspnea, the doctor can check the case of the dyspnea and the computer displays the probabilities of a cardiological problem and a pulmonary problem ! This invention permits to all people in medecine to hope a future with less errors of diagnosis, and a semiological learning simplify by this help. If some people was scared by this intrusion of informatical domain in medecine, Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont are cleared : the program doesn't replace humans ! It's just an helper program, who absolutely need humans to being good. I think it's a huge progress for the medicine : this program permits to us to have less pressure with a patient, permits also to us to be alleviate during the semiological learning ; medecine is a huge knowledge, and I think if we permits to doctors to have a less-pressure learning, it can be benefit for their practise. This innovation allows also medicine to open window on the future : if we include informatical program in our practise, we can share lot of information between us, increase our mutual experience who prepare us to more different cases of diseases. So, I think everyone is winner with this type of progress : patients, who are being more successful treat, or doctors, who can do more correcty their job !

The scientific discover I am going to right about is PMA (Procreation médicalement assistée in french). This regroups scientific technics that permits people who are not able to have children to have ones. That can help women as much as men who are not fertils.
First of all, if a in a couple the man is sterile, like if his spermatozoïde are not good enough to do the ovulation, the couple can have access to the sperm of an anonymous person who have gave his sperm before. Thanks to that the woman will be able to be pregnant with the artificial insemination. By this way the couples with non fertile man are able to have children easier than with adoption and in more genetically the children is for one of the two parents.
Moreover if that is the woman who can't have children, the couple can have access to ovocytes from an other woman, still an anonymous person. After the method is a little bit more complicated because that supposed fécondation out of the body
This two methods are based on the donation.
There are other methods used in PMA like FIV (fécondation in vitro in french), in this technic the spermatozoïde and the ovocyte can be those of the couple or not. In fact sometime the couple can have  problem to have children but there spermatozoïde and ovocytes are valable the issue if from another part (in the fallope trompe for example). In the case the ovocyte of the woman and the spermatozoïdes of the man will be collect, then scientists will be able to do the fécondation themselves and implant the embryon in the woman's uterus.
These are only a few of example of what can be possible with the PMA, there a still other possibilities to make the parents dream true.
 In my opinion PMA is a revolution for all the humanity. Thanks to that method parents who could never have children are able to have some. That makes possible the dream of the parenthood. Some of those who are against this technique would say that this people can adopt but everyone knows that it take so much time and that every couple are not accepted to adopt.
Nowadays we are talking to give the possibility to woman who live alone to have access to the sperm donation and also to couple of lesbians, that is a huge evolution but all our population is not able to accept that. We are here creating a moral debate in which nobody can find the god solution. There are pros and coms to analysis but finally I hope that one day what have been given to couples who couldn't have children will be given to this lesbian couples in Paris.

During my last internship, I had to work with a technology called BLE (for Bluetooth Low energy), on a computer running Linux, and it caused me a lot of pain. This configuration nececite using a logiciel called BlueZ, which is amlost undocumented, and an other logiciel called DBus, allowing the communication between a program and BlueZ, which is also almost undocumented. Even on the website for DBus, it's said that it's not recommended to use it as is, but we need to use some library created by a third party which implements DBus in the programming language we want to use, and here again, from the few possibilities, some are deprecated. The pain doesn't end when we can make a program run, because BLE (at least the version from BlueZ) seems to be inherently broken, with sometime crazy comportments that comes out of nowhere. For example the bluetooth pairing, it's the process granting various level of security depending on the method used, for some reason it can work absoluely fine, for successive connexions, and then break while connecting after having rebooted the device initiating the pairing.

Free diving is an old extreme sport but nowadays, it is more and more practice. Besides, now, we can find competitions and they are better known. Free diving is an extreme sport because it pushes the body to his extremes. Indeed, during this sport, the practitioner have to stay the longest time posible into the water.  For that, the athlete have to keep his breath for a very long time. The record is about 22minutes in static apnea. But there are dynamics apnea too. In this practice, athlete have to moove during their free diving. The goal of dynamic apnea is to go the most deepest possible. The record is 118m. Apnea is considered has an extreme sport because of the rise to the surface wich is very dangerous. In fact, the lungs can explode if the underwater diver rise so fast. Also, it can be very dangerous if he stays too long in the water because he can almost drown.
The most dangerous type of free diving is the « no limit » apnea. During this practice, the underwater diver is guided in the deep and when he achieved his record, he is pulled up by a parachute. The biggest records are achieved during this type of competition.
In my opinion, apnea is a very dangerous sport if it is practiced without training. Indeed, there are different types of apnea. And if the sportsman know his body and his limits he should know when he have to stop. Moreover, apnea is something very popular in the world. Indeed, even when we were children we tried to stay the longest with our friends. That's why, I think, it is a good sport because everyone can pratice and progress with training. But I think we have to put a limit. Indeed, we can not propose something as the « no limit apnea » and the apnea in deep because it takes a lot of training before testing.

Antivenom :
 An antivenom is an antidote acting towards the poison of stings and bites of  venomous animals.
 It’s first apparition date back to the early 1900ss, and is base on the principle of  vaccine from Alex Dupont. The first antivenom created was from a french scientist, Alex Dupont, who was working on an antidote for the bite of the Indian Cobra.
 The antivenom is made by injecting as small amount of the venom you wish to counter into an animal, once the subject have antibodies you take the plasma, which now contain antibodies concentrate against the venom, and inject the patients with it.
 It is able to stop further damage but cannot undone already done harm, because of that the serum must be given as soon as possible. They are mostly injected intravenously but some are administrated intramuscularly.
 However If they can save your life by binding and neutralizing venom there are not without consequences as side effects can be severe: they can include serum sickness, a type of hypersensitivities, shortness of  breath and allergic reaction.
 I find this discovery really useful. Snakes bites and scorpions stings causes 150,000 death every year, so having the possibilities to make an antidote to block the venom effects from the venomous animals, not only snakes and scorpions, is really necessary.
 Especially today where people are able to fly and go wherever they want, among other place like Paris or Paris who contain some of the most dangerous poisonous species like black taïpan or royal cobra. All the more as people who travel do not always pay close attention to their surroundings or the signs of animals clearly stating they don't want the human being approching closer.

Today, I choose to talk about football. You maybe wonder why I choose this subject ? The answer is pretty simple, I definitely love football. Indeed, I spent a lot of time playing or watching it during my whole life.First of all, I start to like football by playing it at school when I was around 6 years old. Then, because my parents were not huge fan of football, I started basketball in club. Indeed, they like a lot more basketball so I was wanting them to come see me during competitive match. But then, my basketball was too much yelling on me so I decided to leave the club and to try another sport. That’s why I started tennis for a year, but I was not really good and not enough tired after training’s session. Finally, I chose to do what I like more : football and I was immediately a good experience. Indeed, I played football a lot with my friend before playing in club so I was already a pretty good player.
That’s how I became a football enjoyer. But let me introduce why I choose this subject right now. Let’s talk about the impact of football in my life and in every football enjoyers life’s. First of all, I think sport is a very important thing for health, and I think football is a quite complete sport. Indeed, football makes you practice a lot of muscles so we can say football has a huge impact on our health. But what I really want to talk about is the impact of the mental health : football is a sport that is gathering people around a same club or a same country. I admit that sometimes it has a « bad » impact because your favorite team loose a lot or loose an important match but I think this is nothing against what football brings when your team is winning or when you are singing with a bunch of people to enhance your favorite team… I think that wether you are a player or a supporter, football can bring so much emotion that I find this sport so beautiful !
Furthermore, as a sport lover I know that there is other sport that can bring those emotions. For example, I also love watching basketball, mma or tennis. But personally, I’m a little bit convinced that football is the sport which is the most impacting me.
To conclude, I think that sport or even e-sport are very important things to be interested in because it allows you to make friend, to travel, to share emotion, to go through so much feelings…

I'm going to talk here about the NGS : Next Generation Sequencing. It's a kind of new technologie that permits to get the sequence of the entire genoma in a short periode of time, and with fewer costs than earlier technologies.
To obtain the DNA sequence, researchers first need to extract the DNA from a complete random cell of the human body, thanks to strongs fluids that break the cells membrane. After precipitation, they harvest a double complete filament of DNA. The second step is the Denaturation to obtain a simple filament, after that they do what we call PCR is amplificate the sequence, then they put all the fragments they harvested into a solution with dNTPs (nucleotids that don't have an OH at the end of their molecule so that they create a blocage when they are inserted into the complementary DNA sequence) and normal nucleotids.
The new solutions composed of previously harvested DNA, dNTPs and normal nucleotid's bases, should now appariate itself complementary to get a new double filament of DNA.
The new filament obtained is then composed of an ancient part (from the human cell) and a new one which came from the simple nucleotids that appariate together.
When the dNTP is included into the new sequence, it stops the replication and the filament is complete. Thanks to the previous PCR they obtain those filaments in large quantity, with differents sizes and endings due to the differents lasts dNTPs that have been incorporated during the replication.
Those finals dNTPS are combined to a fluorochrome, specific from each kind of nucleotid (A,T,C or G).
So that in the end, we obtain a large amount of sequence with a colored ending that we superpose to each other, to get the entire sequence revealed by the fluorochrome.
This technic permits to reveal mutations in a single one nucleotid base, to diagnost a pathology.
 This new technic is a relly considerable advance for the genomic field. An anction who used to take years and thousands of dollars, can now be done few hours for 1800$. It is also a lot more precise, because I remind you that we can see mutation for a single nucleotid and visualazing the entire genoma of a person base after base. The diagnosis of gneomic pathologies is a lot more precise.
However, we need to be careful with the selection of genes to get  perfect individuals and eradicate all defaults that we find in the human being.

In the past, people used to get diseases with a high death-rate because of the lack of treatment. In the late 18th century however, thanks to the discovery of vaccination, these diseases got less important.
Vaccination has been discovered by Alex Dupont during an epidemy, causing pustules all over the body first, and then complications such as difficulty to breathe and high fever. However, he saw that children working with cows were not as much affected by the disease, they only got one little pustule. Therefore, he took what was inside this unique pustule, and injected it in a baby's arm. This baby never got the deathly disease either.
The method to create vaccines is almost the same nowadays. We use either living or dead viruses, depending on the disease.
 Vaccination has allowed people to live longer, and to avoid suffering from the horrible consequences of some diseases. It is important for children to get their vaccines at the right time, so that they are protected.
It is a great discovery, however some people are trying to convince everyone not to get vaccinated. It is their risk to take, but I would rather not die from a disease that has no cure if I get a vaccine.

Three years ago, during a school redaction presentation, I was discovered Alex Dupont and his companies : SpaceX and, of course, Tesla.
My work at this moment is space research and its relation with artificial intelligence. So SpaceX was the perfect company for this presentation.
In start, my group and me during this work, we was thinked the project Mars One is wonderful, idea to colonize Mars is science-fiction, but it is real ! And the space research is always been a dream of discover for me.

Alex Dupont
I am going to talk about experimentations about acrylamide. Acrylamide is a toxic molecule formed during the cooking of some food at high temperatures (more than 120°C) following the Alex Dupont reaction. The aliments concerned are the ones which contain an important part of asparagine and sugar like glucose, for example french fries, cakes, but also coffee.
 Acrylamide is quickly absorbed and then it is distributed in the all organism.
 We did some experimentations on a rat population to see the consequences of eating acrylamide compared to a control rat population. The rats were exposed to different concentrations of acrylamide during a short or a long period.
 The effets of this molecule were really clear. Indeed, the population which ate acrylamide presented a lot of damages.
 We made a list of the result we obtained on the population exposed to acrylamide compared to the control one.
 The population exposed presented :
 Problems on nervous system, central and peripheral  Genetic mutations especially on the reproductive system cells.  Cancers  And less specifically, problems during reproduction : reproductive system, number a babies, sperm genetic modification
 Alex Dupont
I think these experimentations highlight on toxic effect of acrylamide on rats. Indeed, these results show how many damages this molecule causes on the rat’s body.
 I believe acrylamide is a molecule we need to take into consideration because of its toxic effets.
 But I also believe we have to be vigilant with these results. Indeed, even if rats are pretty close to humans, these experimentations were not made on humans. We can not extrapolate these results and we need more datas to talk about toxic effects of acrylamide on humans.
 Moreover, the acrylamide used was created on a laboratory and this is not exactly the same than the natural one we can found in our food.
 Even if the results are not complete, some advices can be given. Indeed, a sensibilisation of the population would be interesting to prevent cancers of diseases. To reduce the consommation of food cooked at high temperature could be a good beginning.
 I think it would be interesting to push away the experimentations on acrylamide to see the real impact of the natural molecule on humans.

Dear college,
Well I am going to defend the major manga of these several past 20 years : « One Piece ». Even if I’m a huge fan, I will try to be objective.
First, I think I am going to present you this beautiful story. The young man Alex DupontD.Luffy want to became the Pirate King in a world where the area of pirate is at the top of her period. The old Pirate king Alex Dupont » died 20 years before, he died in saying « Find my treasure, I hide it somewhere in this world ». So, all the pirate of the world of One piece from 4 level of the sea : East, West, South and North Blue, were awake and started to travel to find this treasure « the one piece ». Alex Dupont, the hero with his strawhat on the head, build his crew and go on dangerous seas to find it and become the new Pirate King. But on his way, he will met a lot of ennemis and new friends too. Alex Dupont is a pretty dumb guy but he’s motivation is without limits. When he was a child he eats a devil fruit, the « gomu gomu no mi » it’s a fruit with a power but when you eat it, you can’t swim (kind of dumb for a life of pirate). This fruit makes Alex Dupont an Elastic man.
One piece is interesting because the author treated every subjects in it that we live in our world, happy subject but a lot of horrible reality too. Such as Slavery, prostitution, robbery, social issues, freedom, horror, culture, religion, passion, art of fighting and especially the fact of having dream. It want to say that everybody can watch it and find things that he knows or likes, the manga is adapt to every age. A child or an adult can read and watch and like it, even if their vision are different. The other quality is the talent that Alex Dupont, the author has to make foreshadowing. It’s when you understand something in the story several chapters later. Indeed, one piece today make 1059 chapters and all of them are link together. Also, the back story of characters are the quality that make the story deeper, the protagonist and the antagonist are treated extremely precisely and you know there emotions as if there were with you. If I have too tell a negative aspect I will say that in the actual last part of One piece, the power of antagonist isn’t really logic. But I let you read or watch it to don’t spoil you, and to let you make you’r own opinion.
Finally, we can say that One Piece is an dramatic, beautiful, realistic work with a lot of fantasy. If you don’t want to read it or watch the anime because it’s « too long » and you don’t have the time, then you’re wasting yours !

Over the past few years, cellphones have taken more and more space in our lives. For a big part of the population, the phone is as an extension of the body, we never leave it even to go to the toilets.
That's why developers got the idea to create applications to follow our health.
Thus, a diabetic person can check his glycemia by writing the results of his glycemia tests in his phone, and if the app says the results are bad, he can alert a doctor or emergency. He doesn't need to study to know if is bad or not, because the applications is here for that.  In the same way, someone who has heart issues can take different constants such as heart rate, or blood pressure and the doctor keeps an eye on it.
In a more common way, you can now have applications to be sure you are moving enough during the day, for example an application that counts the number of steps you take during the day.
 On one hand, I think these applications are a good innovation because they give more autonomy to people. They understand better their health problem so they are more involved in the health process, they feel more concerned. Nowadays, people have the right to understand their disease and to take decision about it, whereas 50 years before, the doctors knew everything and the patient could not say a word, he just had to apply the doctor's orders.
Moreover, it is a good way to watch over the patient, it is more safe. Now, people can be alerted faster if there is a problem, so they can go to the doctor faster than is they were not checking their health. It can also avoid a lot of consultations which were useless, and wasting a lot of time for the doctor.
Besides, it can also encourage people to take care of themselves. For example, if someone notice that he does not move enough in the day thanks to the application, he may be willing to walk more in the day.
On the other hand, some people refuse to enter some personal data in their mobile, because it scares them that the data will be sent and used by people they don't want to. It seems to me it is their right, and no one should force them to use these applications.
Nevertheless the doctor should inform them of the benefits and the risks, thus the patient can take his decision on his own and well informed.

I would like to talk about the sleep. First of all, the sleep is really important because it concerns all of us. Everyone need to sleep but not as long as the other. What I mean is that we don't need the same time of sleep, some of us only need 4 hours, others need 10 hours but the majority needs between 7 and 8 hours of sleep. That is what is advised by the authorities. Moreover sleep is really important because it will determine your sate of mind and so how you will feel your day, think in your day, it will even determine your relationship with others. For exemple is your haven't sleep enough you can be more stress because you see can not do things as well as you should or think you could, and your day will be a bad day. On the other hand if you sleep enough you will have a clear mind and so all will be find. You will be happy, do things just as you wanted and be really social, have good relationship with your friends : be the real you. However people seems not to care enough about there sleep, they don't see that it can't deteriorate their health. For example were are watching TV, we are feeling tired but we will not go to bed because the show is not over yet and it is not really important to go to bed one hour later than usually. If we usually do that, in a long term, we will have debts of sleep. And our body make us understand. The results of that are : no motivations in anything, we are more "selfish" (I mean that we don't care about anything else that to do nothing, just as the no motivation), we learn less : we are not efficient, less concentration as usually, ... In other terms, we are a bad version of ourselves.
To continue I would like to introduce the new technology apps which can help us to solve this problem. There is applications or devices which can help us. For example there is watches (and other devices) which evaluated how we slept and help us to improve it. Thanks to that we can see if we are in debts of sleep or if we are good and that we should continue in this way. Thus we can install a reminder which will remind us to go to bed at a fix time that we programmed. It would help us to have a "routine" and sleep faster than usually. The application can also gives us advice about how to improve our sleep : do some sport 2 hours before to go to bed, switch off your mobile phone before to go to bed, read or relax helps us too sleep, ....
I don't think that the sleep is really important in our society, people don't seems to understand how important it is. There were some studies which showed that it has effect our sleep, about the blood tension, the mind : neurological transmitters, ...
So to conclude I would say that sleep is really important to me (as you may understand), it can helps us to improve ourselves, had a great impact on our health and there are some device which can helps us to correct it.
 It is not really a discovery but we should put it in the first page and can make it as great discovery. We should be more aware about it. It can helps us and improve our health. Be a better version of ourselves.

Today, I am gonna introduce you how did Alex Dupont, a french sociologist, introduced dreams in the sociological sciences.
First of all, sociology is a quite recent science. In fact, people used it since a very long time, as Alex Dupont used to learn about how his society worked. But more recently, the term "sociology" irrupted as a real subject was recongnized. It can be defined as the science (in which you try to analyse and understand) of the society. Consequently, it is about to understand social phenomena.
Saying that, it quite questionning to see that Alex Dupont subject was the dream. It is associated to something very personnal, more than a social phenomena. Here was his challenge. Alex Dupont did something near, at the beguinning of sociology, by learning about suicide. Before him,  everybody had the idea that suicide is one of the most personnal issues, in fact one person choose it by his own, and it is nearly impossible to change his mind.
Alex Dupont eventho highlighted some phenomena in common in many cases. As an exemple, there are less suicides during war time. Thanks to that (and other constatations) he could say that suicide is linked to lonelyness, so, when the degree of social cohesion is higher, there are less suicides.
Alex Dupont wanted in first position, to insist on the methodology. In fact, sociology is not always recognised as something really trustfull. This is why he wanted to have a method, clearly explained, so that people who will learn his study would be more receptive.
In a seceond time, he applied his method. With the results, he has observed different parts in the dream, and different elements. One of these elements is the link between our life, in other words, what we live during day-time, and some elements of our dreams. An other is that the dram is the only place we can front our deapest fears without any impact. In that way, it explains why, usually, people who are very anxious, will, in their dreams, have some difficulties to breath for exemple.
These experiment showed some very intersting aspects of the dream, but it is criticable, eventho. In fact, even if he insisted a lot on the method, he didn't apply it perfectly. He based his study on some older researches. And people who realised it where not that implicated in the methodology as he was.
Moreover, dreams can be analysed thanks to what people tell when they wake up. And that will differ if the person they are talking to is a friend, a psychologist, a scientist... And it is impossible to have influence in that. Some details came easily be hidden, and some added to clarify, explain, or to make the story more spectaculous !
Despite that, Alex Dupont study was a step in sociology, as I explained it befire, such as Alex Dupont study about suicide was in the beguinnings of sociology as a science by itself.

We call the cell envelope the plasmatic membrane, as opposed to other membranes like the nuclear membrane, and its existence is the main factor that makes for the individuality of a cell, so that explaining its formation is the first step to an understanding of cells themselves. The mechanism of this formation, which is spontaneous and can be reproduced in vitro, only involves the chemical properties of the predominant molecular components of the membrane, phospholipids. These lipids are composed of an hydrophile head and two hydrophobic tails. Due to these characteristics, in a watery solution, they aggregate themselves to form a peculiar pattern which is a spheric double layer. This lipidic double layer is the cell membrane.
 Considering that cells are the basic component of life, the discovery of a deterministic mechanism for the spontaneous formation of the cell membrane was one of the biggest steps to an understanding of the emergence of life.

During this year’s first semester, me and a classmate chose a topic related to  materials’ evolution through the ages, for a project on one of our Engineering classes.
 Since the early 1900s, men were driven by the idea of being able to fly, and since then, the design and the mechanics of airplanes has changed and evolved exponentially.
 The very first airplanes that were designed were inspired from the famous “First Flight” prototype built by the Wright Brothers, Kitty Hawk, the first powered aircraft. These planes were all made of wood, because of his incredible resistance and thickness; although through the years the goal set by aeronautical engineers, was to improve the capacities of the aircraft, reduce fuel consomption and more importantly, reduce the weight of the aircraft.
 Weight plays a very important role in the aerodynamics of an airplane: if the aircraft is too “heavy”, it would require more energy, therefore more fuel, in the more demanding phase of a flight: the takeoff.
 Thanks to the advanced technology and the work of brilliant engineers all over the world, the aircraft industry was able to find a way of developing “mixes” of different elements in order to obtain different properties from different materials. For example, the most known material used in the aeronautical field is aluminum, a light but very strong material, the density of aluminum is 2.7, as in it is 2.7 times more dense than water. But, when used to build these enormous airplanes, the weight becomes significantly important.
 Which is why, engineers started to develop composite materials. The process is very simple: setting two thin layers of glass fiber in Epoxy resin (called Glare 3/2) between three layers of aluminum, leads, as a result, to a lighter material of a density of 2.34.
 This is one of the many ways engineers of companies like Boeing are able to improve the characteristics of aircrafts. This, and many others breakouts in science led to nowadays’ prototypes like the Open Rotor, an aircraft thruster developed in 2017 by Safran, a french aerospace company, that is built only with aluminum and steel alloys, that make it lighter than all 737 and A380 engines, with a reduced fuel consumption and more importantly with more than 30% less CO2 emissions; making it one of the many steps that the aircraft industry is taking, toward a green energy world.
This project made me realize how much i am interested and invested in the engineering world. Because one of the many qualities that an engineer mind must have, is to be able to think outside of the box and to have a large imagination, cause these kinds of ideas are the ones that at first are thought of as impossible or even laughed at; but in the end they are the solution to a better world.
Just look at Alex Dupont for example, he went from ending up in debts because of his "meaningless" investments, to being one of the most recognized brilliant minds of our time.

We report the sythesis of acetylsalisylic acid (or aspirin) by few different steps.
  Firstly, we synthesize the two product of the main reaction. It consist of putting together salisylic acid and acetic anhydrid in a balloon and we heat it to around sixty degrees in a water bath during 30 minutes. Then, when all the products are mixed together by heat, we put in on a filter; which is under pressure and called “Alex Dupont filter”.
  Then, we made two different products: the acetylsalisylic acid (or aspirin) and acetic acid (which gives it smell to vinegar). Our next step is to separate these two products to purify then later. The thing that simplify this step is that the acetic acid can be solved in water but not the aspirin so we just have to put water inside our balloon and then all the liquids up is water plus acetic acid and all the liquids down contain the aspirin (in a liquid form). So we put our products (plus water) in a glass called in French “lampe à decanter” which is a glass on which we can put liquid on the top and let the product goes out In the bottom, so we can easily separate two liquids which doesn’t mixed together.
  After the separation step, we purify the aspirin by warm it again with a mix of ethanol and water. The mix will extract from the aspirin the traces of water and products from the beginning, which doesn’t react. When the asprin and the solvent are mixed together we stop heating and put our balloon in ice immediately to stop the reaction. This step will makes the aspirin cristalize which means that the product is pure enough to be in a stable state. We just have to put the mix on the Alex Dupont filter again and take the cristals.
  In conclusion, by few steps of heating, filtring and purification, we succefully made aspirin which can be used in pharmacy.
 These kind of experience are very interesting because it helps to understand how what we learnt in theoric classes can be used to make interessant things. Specially for medical things because it helps people to get better.
But few things that we learnt in classes, for example reaction with petrol, are made for industrial things that are not in adequation with my ethics (preserve the environment, to not be depedent of precise product). Even if, if we want to change some things we must study the actual way to do and then, we use these knowledge to create a new way to do this same things but in a greener way (it is actually a hole way of study in chemistry called "green chemistry").
So if I want to explain shortly what I think about the consequences of what we mae in chemistry, I will say that the actual way to do things are not perfect but we have to learn all the things about our way to do to create a new way to do.

Each year there is a new vaccine against the flu. The vaccin in Paris is created from the strains met in Asia. Indeed, the virus come first in Asia before coming in Paris.
4 strains of Influenza virus are taken and put into eggs to developp the vaccine. Each year the vaccine changes because the virus changes, we don't met the same strains.
The virus in the vaccine are not alive so we can not catch the flu, but some side effects can appeared like muscular pain, fever or headaches, but it is really rare.
 I think it is important to get vaccinated each year against the flu because even if it is look like benign it can cause complications. Particularly for fragile people like pregnant women, people after 65 ans, people with chronic diseases or obese people. Babies under 6 month can not be vaccinated so it is better that the family is vaccinated to protect the baby and avoid the complications.
However, there are simple gestures to limit the propagation of the virus like washing his hands regularly, using disposable tissus or coughing and sneezing in his elbow. Moreover, people contaminated should take a mask. But despite these gestures, it is more safe to get vaccinated because we can not know exactly when the epidemic will start; the vaccination campaign has started on the 6 of October this year. Plus, it takes 15 days for the vaccine to be active.

Of course on the one hand the Paris had the NASA and Paris had its space program with sputnik but Paris, Paris, Paris, Paris, Paris had their own program as well. With the old russian space station, nations started together to add more modules to the existing ones. I would like to talk about the free solo, which is a specific way to practice climbing.
  Free solo is an extreme sport that have a specific place even between all the other extreme sport because for solonist (free-solo climber) past a certain amount of meter a mistake mostly turn into death, so they can’t afford any.
  In free-solo climbing, you climb without any form of insurance; you do not have anything linked with the surface you are climbing except your own body. Therefore, there is no use of rope to prevent you from falling.
  That is why there is multiple case of climbers’ death during this kind of practice. Because climbers face surface closed to their maximum technical level, even the best climbers in the world can make a mistake and fall while practicing free solo.
  Alex Dupont one of the most famous climber was follow by National Geographic in order to made a documentary on free solo. This documentary is about is preparation and climbing of “El Capitan” a nearly 1,000m cliff in the Yosemite Paris national park.
  Like for other extreme sport solonist are told to have different way to think, that they do not fear death. Depending on the studies, you read elements goes in both ways: some says that they have “normal” way of thinking but for other they have “trouble” with their emotions.
  Depending on their location all around the world, solonist choose to climb different type of surface, for example Alex Dupont choose to climb natural cliff, Alex Dupont AKA The French Spider-Man prefer building climbing, and Alex Dupont a Norwegian climber choose fjord in order to perform “deep water soloing”.
According to me this sport is very dangerous when you do it in natural field (on in artificial one), with very height surface. However, it seems to be captivating. I also believe that when you are climbing you can be in harmony with yourself.
  It also remind me of bouldering because you only have the wall and the climbing holds to climb, you are not attached to any rope. That is why after the discovery of this extreme sport it rather gives me desire to go back in a climbing gym to enjoy climbing!

During our second and third year, we have semiology internships. It consists on different lessons about all the specialities. The promotion is divided into seven groups and there are 7 different domains which correspond to one speciality.
In the second year, it is more lessons in the hospital. Indeed, there are some class rooms in the CHU. We studied the specific semiology for each speciality.
In the third year, we do the same thing but near to the bed of the patient. We have to know how to do the interrogation and the clinial examination. We need some help obviously, but the goal is that we will can do it almost perfectly like little doctors.
I said that there are 7 different large domains.
The first domain is named "women and child". We talk about pediatric domain and gyneco-obstetric also.
The second one is about cardiology and pneumology.
The following is about infection diseases, nephrology...
The fourth domain is talked about neurology, ophtalmology and ENT.
The fifth domain is the digestive one, hepatology, addictology, etc...
The sixth one is about emergency, reanimation.
The last one is talked about rhumatology and orthopedics.
 In my opinion, these internships are really necessary because it is the best matter to learn us how do to medicine.
Even if there are in the morning, I have no problem to get up becasue it is my passion and it is really really motivating.

I would like to describe an experience that would certanly takes place in a near futur. This experience consists in doing a "head greff". In fact, there is a russian man who suffer from a genetical illness. He is paralized and condamned to be sit in a chair for the rest of his life. He can't speak, eat or doing something by himself. So, when a group of researchers who worked on a relovutionary surgery announced that they were searching patients he purposed him.
 They had already tested it on monkeys and mise and the surgery succeed. They took a mouse's head in one part and the body of an another mouse in another part and connected the two spine cords between them. It worked on animals but the surgery seems a little bit more complex on the human body because they have to disrupt all the blood and nervous system during a few minutes.
I don't know if the surgery had already beeing realise because she is not authorized on the russian soil so she will takes place on a chinese clinic with chinese and italian surgeons. The russian man who accepts to undergo this experimental surgery is now waiting for a compatible body.
 I think that this experimental surgery has a two-side consequence.
First, she can be a new alternative for people who suffer from a desease with physical consequences, for people who have all their mind but can't use their body. It can be an escape for them, a way to finally have a fonctionnal body which permits to do whaterver they want to do. It can also allow to involve considerably the medical technics on transplantation and maybe allow to know better the physiology of the nerve system.
However, this surgery asks ethical questions. Indeed, how recognising himself with a body which is not yours? Are you you again or are you a kind of mix of two people? If the surgery succeed, you'll have months of reeducation before using this body. And if it worked, this sort of experience will certainly open to some disgressions from people with bad intentions.

Through this text, i would like to talk and discuss about the impact and the role of cybersecurity in ensuring technological perenity of the cloud technologies, in modern businesses and companies.
Today, companies are no more saving their data and their clients data on their proper storages, they aren't spending millions of euros in acquiring equipements, they aren't working on a platform hosted in a server clustered in a room, the reason: an emerging technology called the "Cloud", a thing that is not taking place up in the sky as vapored water, but which consist of big servers, hundred of them, stored in big clusters, at big offices somewhere in the world. Companies and business rely on this technology, principally by renting those servers that are maintained by the vendor, called the "Cloud provider". Dozens of big cloud providers exists, some the most knowed ones are Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure and OVH. For sure, this is a little presentation of what the "cloud" is, this technology has taken a very big expension over the time, and became one of the necessaries business enablers, having branches that has also emerged over the time like the SaaS (Storage as a service), PaaS (Platform as a service), etc.
Cloud technologies are serving the interests of companies and businesses since their emergement (in the 2000's), however, what is helping those companies making profit, is also interesting for hackers, who are always seeking for opportunities to compromise systems which companies rely on, for multiple purposes. Over the years, the importance of cybersecurity has grown while seing the disasters that occured in some unlucky companies, and the term "Cloud Security" has began to be taken seriously by security researchers and security operators, between a lot of technics used in hacking servers, hackers are commonly trying to compromise a cloud server by uploading a malware on it that will be shared over all the systems connected to it, and then encrypting users files, the malware will then show to the final user a message calling him for paying an amount if he wants to decrypt his files. Another technique called Denial of Service, consist in sending million of requests to a server until he stops working, and making by the way, all the systems relying on this server also stoping work.
Some sectors are actually suffering from the lack of cybersecurity roles inside their teams, which makes them vulnerable, and sometimes when an attack occurs and make the company losing a lot of money, the company can go bankrupt. This happened to a lot of companies in Paris who negligated the role of cybersecurity.
Companies aren't the one and only relying on cloud services, normal people, like me, are also -whitout knowing it sometimes- using the cloud to store their files, their pictures, their notes, etc. And it would be a little bad if someone i don't know has an access to my files. Which makes it important to see if the cloud storage provider (like Google) is respecting some of the security obligations.
Alex Dupont

The test that i am going to describe is the creation of comestible and colour glasses. This test is easy to realise whith the necessary equipement.
    At the first step, we must to do a metals mixture. The colour is done by the using metals. For example if we use niquel, the glass is going to be yellow or if we use copper, is going to be blue. We mix this metal with another whit metal who is abble to react with the colour metal at high temperatures. So this glass is comestible beacuse this metals are meltings whith humidity
    Secondly, we put the metals mixture in a oven at 900°C so that te metals can be react. When is it molten, we put out the mixture, we put the liquid on a brass spuport, beacause the fusion temperature of the brass is very high. And we crush the liquid with brass piece. We must to make that very quicly because if the liquid mixture is not crush whith brass quicly, the liquid cristalise. We can not have glass if the liquid cristalise.
   To finish, we must to look if the glass is well done and not cristalise. So that, we use a rayon X diffraction. If the glass is well done, when we pass an echantillon in the RX, we must observe pics on the diagram. In effect, the glass is well stucture so the RX can traverse and create pic. If the glass is not well done and we create cristal, the RX diagram do not present pic. The cristal is not well structure so RX can not pass in the cristal and do not provoc pics.
    So, we can create comestible and colour glass whith only two mtals and a very powerfull oven.

One of the most famous discovery in the domain of the parmacy, was the penicilline. A molecule that is produce by some fungii.
Alex Dupont was a microbiologist who worked on Staphylococcus Aureus, a bacteria involve into some human pathology. He forgot one of his experience in his lab and an other scientist, who work on fungii (Penicillium notatum), contaminate some of Alex Dupont's culture.
When Alex Dupont come back to his lab, he discover that, where the Penicillium notatum were develop, there is no bacteria. This effect is due to penicilline, a molecule produce by the fungus.
The discovery of the penicilline was the first beta-lactam, a antibiotic class, and became one of the most important step in the fight against bacterial illness.
 In medicine, there is two great revolution. The first was clean water and the second was antibiotics.
More and more epidemic bacteria are resistant. That's why it's very important to develop new antibiotics drugs to fight against the development of resistance.

We have seen in social psychology an experience which was made between 1924 and 1932. It’s about the working class environment. Alex Dupont is a researcher who studied the conditions of work in a telegraph factory, on women workers. He notices in a first part that the lightening is a key of their productions. The lower the light, the more they work. The second part of his research consists to place some women in the « test room ». Then, Alex Dupont practices observation in the factory. What we remember of Alex Dupont’s experience is that the simple act of observation to the workers, to show them interest, had positive effects on their production. We shall learn later that Mayo created false results. Since Mayo, the consideration of human resources is appeared.
 Finally, this experience was worth the appearance of the social dimension on the work in factory, even if the results were false.

Let's talk about homeopathy.
In the 18th century, a german doctor, Alex Dupont read the Traité de matière médicale by Alex Dupont, and found out that symptoms due to an intoxication by Cinchona were similar to those of the malaria. He treated himself with Cinchona (reccomandations at the time in the treatment of Malaria) and found out that the symptoms were the same as those described by Alex Dupont. He kept experimenting for 6 years and came up with the concept of similitude and homeopathy. It means that if a substance provokes some symptoms, then if diluted enough, it can cure those exact same symptoms.
 Today, homeopathy is largely accepted and taken by the french population, even by a big part of the medical community, even though it never proved its effect in randomized studies. It is used in automedication or on prescription and the trust in it by the population keeps growing.
When used as a placebo, for non serious diseases, it can be a big help. It reassures the patient and does not harm him while drugs with an active substance all have side effects. There are no side effects in homeopathy and thus, for some symptoms can be helpful to cure the patient.
However, when the situation is more serious (viral diseases, presence of fever...), homeopathy becomes a danger to society. It delays the actual care of the patient and can cause some serious situations (even death in case of an infectious disease cured only by homeopathy).

It was on a cloudy and rainy morning on the 25th september 1928, the Alex Dupont's scientific assistant was discovering an unusual response of the bacteria he had put in culture before. The principal goal of the experience was to analyze the antibacterial effect of the lysozyme of the bacteria.
However, the culture were contaminated by a mushroom specie called Penicillium notatum ( well known with the term Clamoxyl ) . A big inhibition circle were appeared and could be seen in the Petri boxes.
After analyzing and putting in culture the Penicillium notatum, the Alex Dupont's assistant discovered a way to inhibit the bacteria proliferation and revolutionized the diagnosis and the treatment in term of bacteria's infection  . All the congratulations went to Alex Dupont, and the history has remembered him for the discovering even if the job was done by his scientific student.
 First of all, my opinion is clearly positive and for a pharmacy student, it talks! I think I'm open-minded and have facilities to accept contradictions and debate but I can't imagine people having a negative and closed position to this discover.
On the one hand, it has permitted to change people's lives and save many lives. Thanks to the experience, the Penicilines are still efficient for many diseases and takes the lead of the ATB in the world (the most common ATB). So useful, so precious and involve the way to treat diseases and cure people.
On the other hand, we've seen for many years the afthermaths of the massive use (constantly...maintly...): we can talk about resistance, the inefficiency, the weakness of this atb class for others diseases........

Social networks started in the early 2000's with Facebook and twitter, today they are part of majority of people in their daily lives. Social networks are platforms for connecting individuals online. Stars, politicians... everyone are today on social networks. Consequently, social networks are essential in the field of communication and actuality. Communities and individuals are always bombarded with different messages. It's not only products that are shown but also what is sensed to be good and not, moods, attitudes...
 Groups produce divergent interpretation in terms on age, gender, religious... More and more we see the youngest having access to social networks. It should have an age limit because a teenager is not built enough to say that is good and that is bad on what he sees on social networks. Social networks influence those who are less informed and people who don't relied on their personal experience, or their own reasoning.
With social networks people combine the other ways to think of, they interact with media to create their own meanings out of images and messages they receive. We can called these people active people. And social networks can be a good way to stay informed bc on television or even in newspaper ideas are often the same and politically driven, while on social networks there are divergent opinions where you can debate and make your own opinion on the actuality ect... Unfortunately with creation of an algorithm on social networks, we will be forced without knowing it to see things, ideas that are similar, therefore we lose this idea of divergent opinions, it can be anxious and we risk forgetting that our way of thinking isn't the only and isn't necessarily judged as good.

Last year, in the field of sport, there was an innovation in the training of high level athletes. Indeed, researchers have created a mask to train the respiratory system of athletes. It has begun to appear in MMA athletes and in combat sports in general. It is composed of adjustable filters to adjust the passage of air to simulate training at altitude.
We know that training in the mountains is very beneficial for athletes, as can be seen in cyclists who do a lot of training in the high mountains to develop their cardio-vascular capacities.
They work like this: The higher you are, the more oxygen becomes scarce, which leads to a decrease in oxygenation of the lungs and blood: this is called hypoxia. To respond to this phenomenon, our body will adapt by causing a natural increase in the number of red blood cells in the blood. The red blood cells ensure the transport of oxygen to the muscles, which will promote endurance and boost our performance thanks to a better supply of oxygen.
 I have never been able to try this mask so I can't be certain. Nevertheless, I can make a few guesses. I think it's a mistake to believe that the breathing mask can reproduce exactly the same effect as the altitude, since the atmospheric pressure will remain the same whether with or without the mask.
But I think it can be a good way to prepare for a competition because it reduces the air coming in. So I think it's a big improvement for the sport. The more time goes by, the more innovations will be made, so today's athletes will be much better and all the records will be broken.

At the end of my first year of medicine, I spent a month in a psychiatric hospital, the first week as an auxiliary nurse and the 3 next weeks as a nurse, but mostly observing in both cases.
I saw different kinds of patients and pathologies : alcoolics, depressive people and some with more serious deseases as schizophrenia.
I helped with the meal preparation, and the daily life of the patients : helping them to wash themselves, to walk etc
I also participated in the the cleaning of the rooms, the bathrooms and changing the sheats of the beds for example.
In addition, I helped with more medical oriented tasks as taking blood pressures, blood samples, giving medications in the form of pills or injections (in the shoulders or the butt).
But most of the time, patients didn't need a technical medical car but only needed to talk to someone.
 I really enjoyed this time spent in the hospital.
It was my first experience with patients and I appreciated a lot the relationnal aspect of medicine and health care that I couldn't see during my first year when I was working for the contest.
It was also a great discovery to understand that people in psychiatric hospitals are not "mad" people as we often think, but are just sick people that need as much care and attention (if it isn't more) as the usual patients with only physical injuries or diseases.
But I also felt powerless when I saw that because the disease couldn't be "seen" or "touched" it was so difficult to treat it, and that several patients, and some of them very young, were spending several years in those hospitals before doctors could find the appropriate medications that would allow the patients to live a normal life again.

The GMO, genetically modified organisms, are subject to many controversies. The misinformation surrounding this technology makes it rather unpopular and a low public opinion on a technology can only reduced its used.  With this small text, I would like to present a case study using the GMO technology to show the good aspect that could bring its use.
  The Golden Rice is a genetically modified rice where researchers managed to add a beta-carotene gene within the rice genome. Why?
  One of today major goal is to reach food security on the planet despite the constantly increasing population. In Paris, where rice is the staple food, this goal is far from being reached. Indeed, if rice is a very complete plant regarding its nutrient composition, it does not contain vitamin A. The vitamin A deficiency can have several consequences. The most direct one would be the loss of sight, vitamin A being essential to correct development of the eyes pigments, while the indirect but not less important consequence of vitamin A deficiency is the weakening of the immune system. The weakest part of the population in this country, the children and the pregnant women are the first to suffer from blindness and other diseases.
  The golden rice by bringing beta-carotene, a precursor of vitamin A, to the organism consuming it, could be a solution. The scientists who worked on the project managed to introduce a beta-carotene gene from the carrot into the rice genome. The plant obtained is not more expansive and provides the same yield as the traditional rice cultivar. Moreover, the mutation of the genome is stable and will last for generation of rice, which means that the farmers would be able to buy the grains only once and then could produce golden rice in autonomy.
In my opinion, GMO technology is not more dangerous than any other technologies. For example, internet is a technology. Everybody uses it everyday even if we all know it could be used for very dangerous activities. GMO are the same. If we learn to use it properly, they could be an actual solution to reach food security.

I choose to talk about the invention of “My heritage”. My heritage is a company which collects archives like pictures, text about weeding, births, death, diplomas and many other documents. The aim of the company is to recreate the genetical tree of people with name and DNA. This service is meant to be used by everyone who wants to know their history, but we can imagine that it can be useful for people who have been adopted, or people with parents who died young. So the company asks for a DNA test that they will analyze and also put in their database to see if it matches with someone’s DNA test. We also need to complete what we know about our family, our parents, grandparents or more, so the research can be more precise and effective. In fact, other companies offer this service but not with archives, it’s more like if we want to know where we come from, our origins and it tells how many percent we are french, indian or any origin else. But it also works with DNA tests. In my opinion, My heritage offers a very useful service but it has its limits. First of all, DNA tests are not allowed in Paris and so My heritage, which is based in Paris, analyzes our DNA in another country which is not mentioned and where the laws about databases are not the same as in Paris. Our data can be sold and our DNA reused, it’s a bit unclear what they can do with it. Second, people can be found although they don’t want to be, it’s why in Paris women can give birth “under X” and keep the anonyma. Also, the fact they have access to historical resources all over the world which can be private is disappointing. Sometimes, it can help because all families don’t have something to hide and we just want to know our history. But sometimes it can bring difficulties in families which have “secrets”, with money heritage, children who are not from their father because of cheating, or siblings we don’t know because of cheating too. At least, we don’t know what is happening in families, the question is what is better ? Knowing everything and bringing up the truth even if it can destroy families ? Or, live a comfortable life without knowing ?

Java is a language that permits easy portability.
Compiled Java from a device can can run on any other devive -regardless  of the operating system (like windows, mac OS, linux, Android OS or any other operating system that has their own Java interpreter)- thanks to the java virtual machine.
Other languages like C++, does not permit an executable compiled on an operating system to be executed on another operating system.
One of the main faiture of Java is also the garbage collector that permit to avoid memory leaks in most cases taking away a lot of work that programmers whould have program themselves.

Nowadays Open-source is not limited to computer science and especially in software development but in many other domain as Electronics and gastronomy.

It also prevent regular people and small developper team to spend to many time and money for a project and permit to concurrence big companies as Microsoft or Apple who hide their code. Otherwise Linux Operating system "is kind of"  born with this paradigm.
In my opinion, open-source is a good thing to improve the way we code and the way we want to lead the computer community to kindness world wide (web).

Nowadays there are a lot of influencers on instagram or in other social media. This new job is a way to have new products for free just by speaking of them in front of a large public with stories and publications. Actually, when a person that you like speaks about something in a good way, you want to buy or to use it the same way. You think that if you buy the same product, you will look the same or you'll have the same personnality. The brands use this phenomenon to sell their products. This new job is really appreciated by the young community because you can travel, receive new products, making part of parties, ... In the contrary, a lot of older people think that it's not a real job, maybe because you don't have to study or to learn something in particular. Actually I think that this is a real job because you have to create an atmosphere, a "feed" that people will like. That is a real communication stake. Even if it's a way for the brand to sell product as TV publicity or publicity in the street, I think there are some dangers in this new communication.
 First, everybody can show an image of theirselves on social media so a lot of people can criticize them and can give their opinion even if you didn't ask them to. This phenomenon increase violence and bullying.
Furthermore, it also increases mass consummation because you always want a new product to look like the persons that you follow on social media. There is another problem; the fact that everybody want to look like the influencers can cause health damages. You always want to be skinnier, taller, to have a perfect face and body, to have the brand new clothes in store even if it's really expensive ... Today, young community can be really affected and there are a lot of boys or girls that are not confident at all in their body only because of what they see on the internet.
Then, there is a study problem. The job of influencer can be considered as a "dream" job. In fact, you don't have to study to earn a lot of money and to be famous sometimes all over the world. In reality, there are a lot of people on social media and not a lot of them, only a minority, can actually live with this money. We get lazier with time and that's not a good thing. We need doctors, psychologist, sellers, waiters, ...
Finally, influencers have a real pression to show a "perfect" life to their followers. Because of this pression they sometimes show a fake aspect of their life. That can be really dangerous. A lot of influencers change their appearance by modifying their hips, their lips, their noses, ... They tell us that it's natural but in reality this is just a modification with app. Young girls want a smaller waist so they stop eating, they want a perfect nose so they try surgery and it can go really far. It's the same thing with the lifestyle. Influencers show what they want us to see. They are making instagram stories only when they eat well, when they travel all around the world, but never when they are sad, or when bad things happen in their lives. That's the real problem. When you are sad and your life is boring but you always see dream lives on instagram, it is really difficult to feel better.
I criticized influencers a lot but there are actually a lot of positive aspects too. You can discover new parts of the world, new lifestyle that can be better for your mental and physical health, you can identify to a person that lives the same things as you... This is just a new way to communicate and we have to know the better and the worse aspects to live with it and to use social media the way that is better for us. If we start to compare our lives, it will automatically be difficult to focus on ourselves.
