In world of mobile application developpement we have many tools which help to make an application.
We have also differents ways to product mobile application with frameworks:
React Native developed by Facebook which is based on JS(JavaScript Language), We have also Xamarin App Development with Visual Studio of Microsoft company.
Ionic for hybrid application development which allow to develop one application and generate android and ios version.
But this last framework have disadvantage. it does not allow to develop powerful applications using the native functionalities of android and ios devices. Also  to develop an application, companies are obliged to recruit both android developers that ios to do the work. What costs is  expensive.
To resolve this problem, google has presented a new framework which name is Flutter at the Mobile World Congress from Monday, February 26 to Thursday, March 1, 2018 in Paris.
Flutter is Google's mobile UI framework for make high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and companies around the world, and is free and open source.
The framework has different features such as Hot Reload, which allows you to test your mobile application prototype more quickly. Flutter is available on all operating systems (Windows, Mac and Linux) and even on virtual machines (Visual Studio Code and Android Studio).
 It's a great innovation. Now, technology companies will no longer need to recruit android and ios developers  but rather a single developer who can use this tool to produce a robust application, powerful for the various terminals. The best part about flutter is that you have a wide range of widgets beautifully catalogued for you. Not only does it make it hassle-free but also helps you make a functionally amazing app. You use Dart language to write your Flutter app which is compiled to native code and generate ios and android version of your application. Google Flutter is a gift. Eye-catchy interface, faster app development process, flexible APIs  and few more features makes Google Flutter a mobile technology friendly tool.
The world of mobile development has just cognized a great revolution.

The influenza is an infectious disease which exist since approximately 6000 years in birds and less time in human. The influenza is frequent and contagious, she returns every year in an other "version", so the vaccine of the last year is not longer suitable. So we must to vaccinate every year according to the influenza of the year. We can recognize this disease thanks to somes symptoms : fever, headhache, aches, runny or stuffy nose, sometimes vomiting... This can last 1 week without going to the doctor, for someone who is not vulnerable. But for someone who is vulnerable (kids, elderly, person suffering from chronic illness) they must to consult because this can be realy dangerous for them. People which are contaminate need to get plenty of rest, drink a lot of liquids (water is better), take a paracetamol to let down the fever and relieve the muscle aches. And stay close at home to avoid contaminate other people.
 The influenza is not a funny thing. When you are contaminate you can't make a lot of thing because you're really tired, you're cold, you have pain everywhere so we just must waiting in your bed with 10 coatings on you, a hot water bottle, tissues, and a bowl of soup that mum did with love.
The influenza remain a disease really dangerous because she caused a lot of death every year.

The Alex Dupont effect is a psychologic bias and a manipulation technic. How it's Works ? A person make a wide and blur description of some widespread trait of personality who can be apply for everybody and make them yours. This discovery is due to Alex Dupont a psychologist, the name of the phenomene is in reference of the Alex Dupont circus who created a trick of "cold mentalism", where he tell banality about someone personality but it's seems like mentalism. The Alex Dupont effect is widespread on astrologism and other esoteric sciences. Further Alex Dupont theorize this effect with an exprerience on this students. he describes one-on-one thier personality each time with the same text and he ask them to grade his prediction on 5. He obtains a average of 4,25 on 5 with a hundred of students. Some seaches show this effect is more efficient on people who looking for attention or approbation of their pairs.
 In my opinion, this search need to be more known by many people, this effect turn wrong many esoteric sciences because lot of people count on their prediction, they use the need of attention of the people but also their need of answer about some questions who can't be answer, especially about their career, a dead member of familly or about love.

I will talk about the discovery of the vaccination.
During the sixteenth century, there was an important desease called variola. It causes skin lesions such as buttons, or ulcer. Sick people had bad injuries and were desfigured. There were a lot of variola epidemia during spring.
During a stay in Paris, a notable women called Alex Dupont, discovered that some children received a little moisture containing piece of sick people of variola. She was surprise because she had variola and had a lot of scars because of the desease. She noticed that this children wouldn't get variola. She brought this invention in Europe. We call it variolation.
Few years later, an english man, Alex Dupont, observe that some people did'nt get variola : the cowherd. They were in touch with the cow, and Alex Dupont concluded that the cow was the solution : the virus of the cow was called the vaccine, and he could prevent cowherd from the variola. He tried to transfered the substance from the cow to the human. He invented vaccination in 1796.
This discovery was a medicine revolution : we can prevent a desease and avoid it.
 The vaccination discovery was a revolution in medicine, for the better.
The medicine exists for cure and treat deseases. But it's better if people don't get sick ! It saves a lot of lives because we found a lot of vaccin against serious deseases such as diphtheria, tetanus or poliomyelitis, which could be mortals. So now, medecine can cure, treat and also prevent deseases !
In my opinion, of course I think it's an excellent discovery.

Poems were telled by parents to childrens, history like the Bible were teached in a religion process, and the few books written were shared between people.
Then, thanks to printer, people could acces to a book for themselves. Things changed and reading book alone at home became possible. From a social pratice, sharing became possible being solo. With that, the number of people who know how to read and write increased and personnal books scaled in the world. So, anybody who could and wanted to write a part of their personnal history, a brand new story or whatever, could be share with anybody who know how to read.
Nowadays, almost every people which received an education know how to read and write. With the arrival of internet, social media and stuff like that, people's story can travel the entire globe. Communication has evolved all along human's creations. However, relations between humans have not followed the same path, but took a different one. With all the tools around us, we now communicate differently than before. People migth spend more time alone because there are now so much to do alone. Entertainment, sharing or learning are at the time both social and personnal activities. With all the pros and cons each breakthrougths bring to us, it's always how it is used that matter. It's always a matter of balance.

The basic component of a computer is a transistor, it's a piece of technologie wich can be in two states open or close wich can let pass or block the current, these transistor associate make logic doors wich can be of different types. First the "not", wich reverse the input wether it is a 1 or a 0 (wich mean that the current is high or low) Second their is the "and", wich gives back a 1 when all input are high and 0 if not, third the "or" door which gives back a 1 when their is at least one input high and 0 in other cases. And with these three logic doors you can build a computer  by adding them in circuits, you can build memory card, Algebric logic unit wich are the component of a computer.
 computer where realy expensive and big at the beginning only big companies could afford it but personnal computer revolutionized the world by giving people acces to knoledge almost for free with the internet, giving employees the possibility to work everywhere, even at home, people can study with there computer, can chat, can ask questions "how to do something ? ", "where is the neares restaurant ? " .

Solar Impulse : tomorrow’s challenge
  During these last few years environment has taken a bigger place in our lives and this is one of the main challenge the world has to face in the future. In the same time the growth of the world’s population and  the travelling people around the world, push developers to explore different kinds of transports. How can we combine these two areas ? The Solar Impulse is one first step in what we can do with environment and transport.
  First of all, the first prototype of Solar Impulse was released in 2009. The main goal for its creators was to built a plane entirely autonomous in energy. The pane does not need any fossil fuel to fly, but only the energy offered by the sun. To convert this solar energy (radiation) into electricity, the wing’s plane are recovered by solar panels made of silicon. These wings are made of different layers. The photons presents in the sun radiation interacts with the electrons presents in the layers. Thanks to an intern process electricity is created. Finally, create electricity is not that hard ; but to being able to fly a long distance, the plane needs to create electricity in mass.
  In addition of producing electricity the plane has got an other challenge to face : autonomy which is directly linked to safety ; of course we do not want the plane to be forced to land in the ocean or in the Paris as the captain Alex Dupont did in 2009. At the beginning, the Solar Impulse could made only short travels and mostly during the day when there is more sun. It is true that they had to find a solution to being able to fly during the night when there is no sun at all. After few tries they decided to add big batteries (four) on the wings to stock the energy produced during the day but not used. That way they achieved their first world’s tour in July 2016. Finding a plane able to travel all around the world in an ecological way is  a real breakthrough. The next step today will be to built a Solar Impulse for commercial flight.
  Last but not least, the challenge of tomorrow is to create a plane on the Solar impulse’s model to transport passengers from a town to another, with a not to high cost.
  The problem today is that commercial planes are bigger and bigger and the rapport of their weigh and their surface is to short. In fact, if we want to transport as many people as in actual commercial flight, the future solar plane will need a huge surface to welcome a lot of solar panels. Of course such a weigh (plane and passengers) needs a big quantity of energy. Today all these challenges are not compatible and developers need to find THE idea which can change the future. As an aeronautic fan, I am looking forward for that day. It would be a date to remember for sure.
 It was enriching fro our skills.

Twitter is a website which has been released in early 2006 in Paris. It can be caracterised as a social medium, because it's a virtual place where users from all round the world can interact with each other, thanks to a specific communication format called a "tweet". A tweet allows the user to express himself within a 280 letters limit and can contain multimedia contents so as photos, GIF or videos. Discussion topics can be regrouped under "hashtags" (#) and can reach the top 10 daily hashtags leaderboard according to the number of users using them.Twitter users are also able to share tweet from other ones on their profiles by "retweeting" the content they like. In 2022, Twitter is one of the most used social media in the world. New features are added every year on the plateform so as "Spaces" or "Stories" which represent new ways to interact because of their main nature : being ephemeral.
 According to my own experience, Twitter is a dangerous place. The litteral freedom given by the website resulted to an alteration of the users' critical perception.
Today people stand by their opinion and almost never change their minds. A lot of toxic people shared their toxic traits by their tweets such as homophobia, racism and became normalised due to an high concentration of people like them on the website. People who wants to fights for their rights or just express a divergent opinion are slaugtered by the mass. It makes Twitter a toxic social medium.

As I worked in a lab last summer, I discovered a new kind of analysing process. It isn’t actually very new because it exists for few years now. Indeed, PCR (PolyChain Reaction) was invented about a decade ago. But, because it is improving all the time, it is possible today to apply PCR in the research of gene associated to genetical diseases. First, we must understand how a PCR works. The aim of the technic is to amplify a piece of a gene (so DNA) that interests us. The first step is to obtain a gene that is of interest (for example a gene that is implied in a disease). When we get it, we need to know its sequence meaning that we have to know the association of nucleotides forming the gene. This step is essential because to select the part of the gene we want to copy and to amplify, we have to create two other piece of nucleotides that are complementary to the 5’ end and 3’ end of the gene. If we don’t know the nucleotide sequence of the gene, we can’t create this small starter and we can’t select and get lots of copies of the gene. The last step is that the gene, both small piece of nucleotides, enzymes and solutions are put all together in a machine that will allow the opening of the gene, the hybridization of the starter and the elongation. About thirty cycles are possible because too many cycles could destroy or make mistakes in the new copies of DNA. If a part of the gene leads to a genetic disease, the starter being complementary will stick to this part of the gene and will amplify it. Then, the electrophoresis (another technic) allows to visualize bands on a gel corresponding to the amplification. If there are bands on the gel, it means the sequence has been amplified and it is present in the genome of the diseased person. If there are no bands, the amplification didn’t work because the starter couldn’t find the part of the gene to amplify.
To my mind, the PCR technic is a must to have now in a laboratory. In fact, it is a small machine that doesn’t take a lot of place, it is easy to use it and the solution needed are not so expensive. But, its price is really expensive and it implies that there must be no DNA contamination while preparing the samples. I can understand that all laboratories can’t afford it.
  Also, I think that having the possibility to select a piece of a gene is a very interesting improvement for scientists and patients. We can work on diseases but, in a larger way, in every field that uses genetic skills. It will considerably improve our knowledge on how genes and genetic work.
  Finally, I really like working with PCR because it makes the analysis way much shorter than classical assays in tubes. Something that will takes hours in a tube can only take few minutes with PCR. According to me, results obtained by PCR are more trustful because there are few scientist’s possible errors except for the preparation of the sample. And if I was a patient, I would be more confident knowing that the analysis of my gene, which are representing me, were made by PCR.

In 1969, Alex Dupont was the first man to walk on the moon. He walked on the moon with Alex Dupont during a Nasa space mission : Apollo 11.
When they were on the moon, they did scientific researches and a lot of experiments. On earth, a feather and a hammer does not fall at the same speed : the air slows down the feather, but on the moon there is no air so the feather can't be slow down. Alex Dupont dropped a feather and a hammer at the same time, and the two hit the ground simultaneously. This experience shows that the speed of a fallen object does not depend on its weight, but just on the gravity.
Furthermore, the moon landing was live broadcast on TV in the Paris. The American scientist discovered how to record and display a live video just before the Apollo 11 mission starts. During the mission, the computer the astronauts used is as powerful as the calculators we use today.
Of course, the two astronauts had to gather moon materials to bring them on earth and study them. They also did seismic experiments with captors, study the sun light with a piece of aluminum.
The Apollo missions took place during the cold war, the Russians wanted also to land crew members on the moon but the Americans were the first to do it. On the other side, the Russians were the first to send a man into space.
Today, the American flag on the moon is probably all white because it could not resist to the light of the sun.

I did an internship at Carlsberg Laboritory Research in Paris. My subject was on the dry hopping and  hop breeding. Hops are an aromatic plant and it use on the beer to develop bitterness or to deliver aromatic oil to the beer. Normally, during the beer process, hops is add at the end of boiling step (15 minutes before the end). This method develop a bitter aroma because at this temperature all aromatic oils contains on hops is evaporate.
Now, the dry hopping consist to add hop pellets during the fermentation step. The temperature is around 15°C and aromatic oils stay on the beer. With this technique, we could create a lot of different taste. There is a lot of hops varietes with unique character.
The interresting part of this project was to test different hops with different yeast. The fermentation step need yeast who will eat sugar in the beer and producing alcohol. With the dry hopping, we add hop at the same time. During this experimentation, the development of flavor and aroma due to aromatic oil contains in hop pellets was totally different with the different yeast.
 Thanks to this experiment, the best yeast was identifie, the yeast who develop a stronger and good aroma. Because certain yeast develop a bad flavour and taste. Add hops pellets during the fermentation step with yeast permise to develop more aromatic oil contain on hops pellets. This results is really interresting, that means we could use less hops pellets and have the same aromatics oils quantites on the beer, the same flavour and aroma. The price of hops pellets is really expensive (40 euro for 100g and we need 1 g for 1L of beer) so it's a possibility to decrease the price of the production.
Another good point of this experimentation is the huge possibility to create new flavour and new aroma on the beer. There is a lot of hops varietes and a lot of yeast, we could test a lot of combinaison and discover new flavor. Hops is really an interresting climbing plant and I think it's the future of beer development.

Plant transgenesis or gene delivery is the process of modifying the genome of plant by introducing one or more foreign genes artificially. This can be done with several genetic engineering methods including direct transformation technics like biolistics or Agrobacterium tumefaciens mediated transformation technic. Before all, a gene of interest in engineered in vitro usually in a bacterial system (Escherichia coli). For indirect transformation with A. tumefaciens, mostly used method, the engineered gene is then inserted in a plasmidic vector and introduced to A. tumefaciens. Thanks to a particular plasmid (Ti plasmid), existing only in A. tumefaciens species, the inserted gene can be transferred to the nuclear genome of host plant tissues (grown in vitro) sine they are exposed to each other. Plants can be regenerated from the transformed plant tissues and tested for the introduced gene expression.
The development of plant transgenesis technics revolutionized crop genetic improvement field. Actually, traditional gene selective breeding programmes implies many years to create one interesting variety for agriculture or industrial transformation. Whereas a gene delivery program can produce several enhanced varieties a year. Moreover, transgenesis enables researchers to introduce interesting transgenes originating from different kingdoms (Animalia, Plantae, Fungi, Bacteria, …), a possibility that provides much more genetic diversity to improve crops. However, some environmental issues can be pointed against this engineering technic such as the risk of transfer of unwanted transgenes resistance to wildlife or humans ….

The nuclear fusion is the reaction generally happen the star, this reaction fusion two atoms (bassically hydrogen), this fusion create a helium atom and release a enormous energy.

 The phenomenon is very interresting because, it realese a big amount of energy, more than all the differrents ways to convert energy on Earth.
 This is why a lot of differents contries would be the first which have a functional nuclear reactor.
 The three biggest reaserch center are based in Paris, Paris and Paris.
 In Paris they have two centres of research which experimenting two ways to create nuclear fusion.
 In Paris, they have the « Megajoules Laser », this method used a very powerfulled laser to create a high temperature zone, in this zone the atom can fusionned.
 And finally ITER around Paris , which used the plasma method. This method also used a high temperature zone, but this zone are create with a plasma (the plasma is the fourth states of the matter in the universe, a big amont of matter at very high temperature). The plasma was be created by very big and powerfull electromagnet, that can heated the matter at high temperature and can create nuclear fusion.
 In MIT in Paris, the nuclear fussion lmab research was the first who create a plasma (with the electromagnet method) during a long period (around a minute) this is the world record for now.
 The nuclear fusion also used hydrogen, and hydrogen is prensent in really big quantity in all the ocean on Earth, it is quite easy to found conposents.
 The nuclear fusion can be a revolution of the energy, because we can transformed energy  easily , in a big quantity and with a little part of dangerous components, but is far to be create a lot of different reaserch center always push the deadline , because of different technical problems, and they probably finish a fonctionnal reactor in 10 to 30 years.

Let me introduce you the discovery of the molecular and cellular mecanisms from the human developpement. It have been permitted by the genetics controls  of developpement in xenope, mice and drosophilia. All of this insects and animals had permitted to observe many differents molecular and cellular agencements into the observed embryos.
For example, into drosophilia embryos, it have been revealed the molecular mecasims wich have permitted to highlight the polarisation system according to the antero-posterior axe. Indeed there is three molecular system who permit the polarisation of the embryos. First of all, there is some maternel genes which are fixed or not on the embryos cells. We can quote bicoïd, Hunchback, nanos or caudal. There are here to initiate the cascade of events and in fine activate the second wave of genes called GAP genes wich permitted to separate the embryos in 14 parasegments, here we can quote too some genes, like Hunchback, Krüppel, Knirps and many others. This second wave will permit to engage the third and last activation of the embryos, by activating two genes families : primer pair rules genes (regulated by gap genes) and second pair rules genes (regulated by primer pair rules genes). Finally all this cascades of events will permit to tell what segment of the futur drosophilia will have wings, legs or eyes.
 Those experiments and the enhancement of the biochemicals techniques have permitted to take a big step into the comprehension of the developpement of the living things.

Scientific researchers have created a tool that improves sportive performances. It consists on electrical discharges focused on the motor cortex of the brain. Sportsean use it before their training in order to stay efficient longer and to recover better.
Researchers have noticed that the fatigue felt after a physical exercice was due to the exhaustation of the brain, more than the muscular tiredness.  Therefore, stimulating the motor cortex enables to last longer in a race for instance, without feeling any pain for a longer time.
 Researchers have noticed the efficiency of the technic. They organized experimentations: they measured the muscular strenght before and after a specific time of running. When they added the electric discharge at the beginning of the race, the sportmen had almost the same strenght before and after running. Without the stimulation of the cortex motor, the musuclar strenght was totally down after physical pratise.
Various people in different sports, have decided to give a try to this new technology in order to enhance their performances and to improve their results.
Yet, it actually brings with it the issue of doping: for the moment the international group against doping has confirmed it currently does not enter in the definition of doping since it is not specific substance introduce in the body.
Yet, we may wonder whether It will not be issue is some years when this technic will have spread over the sport community. I seems to give a huge advantage for its users and could reveal ethical questions.

integrative approaches to guide conservation decisions.Using genomics to definie conservation units and functionnel crridors
 climate increasing habitat loss

TRANSPOSABLE ELEMENTS
  The transposable elements (TE, or more commonly called transposons) are mobile DNA sequences of variable length. The structure of a transposon is as follows : a central sequence is delimited at each side by repeated (identical) sequences. They can be classified into two main classes regarding the nature of those repeated sequences : (1) the DNA transposons which are delimited by terminal sequences orientated towards the same direction, and (2) the retrotransposons, for which the terminal sequences face each other. The difference between the DNA transposons and the retrotranposons also resides in the way they move in the genome. While the first ones move following a cut-and-paste process, the second ones are transfered to other regions of the genome following a copy-and-paste process.
The TEs can also be distinguished based on the content of their central sequence, which conditions their ability to move autonomously or not from their initial locus to a new one.
 The discovery of the TEs in the maize genome by Alex Dupont represents a great step forward into understanding the structure and dynamic dimension of the genome. It allowed scientists to finally understand how some genomes, no matter how close they were related one to another, could differ so much in their size. Indeed, the TEs make up for 50% of the human genome, and can represent up to 85 % of the big genomes of cereals.
Moreover, the dynamism of the TEs has surely played (and will keep playing) a great role in the evolution of species. Due to their ability to insert themselves into a random genomic region, they indeed can alter or even unactivate genes.

Quantification of energy has always been a key idea in physics and is now teach practical classes of physics. An experiment to understood this abstract concept is the analysis of light using diffraction. It is based on the fact that lights rays are emit by atoms when they desexcites, liberating energy. It goes to a final quantum state of energy from an initial quantum state and free energy under the form of a particle of photon, which is a no mass particle.
 The purpose of the experiment is to use the diffraction of the light emits by a hydrogen luminescent tube to find the quantification states of the hydrogen atom for each quantum number. This technique involve a goniometer, which is a device that diffract light with a network and then gives us the angular diffraction of fundamental rays of this particular light. Furthermore the atoms are excite by an electrical field, it passes in the tube filled with gaze of the element we are working on and by giving energy to them as so detestation appears as they cannot stay excite.
 First to start on the hydrogen state of energy we need to find a crucial parameter: the number of string of the network that diffract the light. So we know the light rays he emits by the mercury element and can retrace their wave length, we are using a mercury luminescent tube to determine the parameter. Thanks to a physical formula including this wave length, the number of string and the sinus of the angle of the diffracted light obtained by the goniometer, we are able to approach this number and continue the experiment.
 In a second time, we replace the mercury tube by a hydrogen one and repeat the process through the goniometer. At this time we are just able to pick up the values of the angle of the rays and using the same formula as the first part of this experiment we can calculate the final wave length.
 Moreover other formulas of physics help us is our research of the values of energy as well as Energy=(Plank constant*speed of light)/wave length. The energy here is the variation between the initial and the final state and using mathematical deductions we found the values of energy for each state of quantum number for the hydrogen atom.
 This was a very interesting experiment to work on.

For a year now, I am doing an internship in a laboratory. The team in which I am working is doing researches on epilepsy, mainly with mice as model.
The experiment I am currently working on is the audiogenic seizure. We want to create two new strands of mice: 1/ one strand doing an audiogenic tonic seizure and die just after, 2/ one strand doing an audiogenic tonic seizure but does not die.
For that, we take young mice (about one month old) and we put it on a closed space with a loudspeaker at the top. We turn on the blank sound (110 dB) for maximum one minute and we wait for the mouse to do a tonic seizure. If the mouse does not react, we have to sacrifice it. If it reacts, we keep it and mark it on its ear. If the mouse dies, we ventilate it to resuscitate it.
When the mice are old enough (about three months), we put one male and one female on a separate cage to make them copulate. Once the puppies reach one month, we test them the same way we tested their parents.
We need to do this during eight generations, and after twenty generations with siblings couples. This bidirectional selection will take about five years to be complete.
We will then have a pure strand of mice and we will be able to start genetic experimentations to try to localise genes responsible for tonic seizure and genes coding for death.
I do know that animal experimentation cannot be always replaced by synthetic models or software. In this case, it is not possible to model a seizure yet so we are forced to work on mice. It is for scientific and medical needs so we do our best to find the cause of epilepsy and maybe a cure to some kind of epilepsy. Because, yes, a lot of different epilepsy exist. It takes plenty of time to take care of an animal facility. We try to make our mice the less stressed as much as possible. But still, it is every time a heartbreak to sacrifice some of our mice. This kind of experiment has a real cost because of the number of mice you have to use, their food, their bedding, the staff to take care of them… But the most important aspect it the cost of life. Too many mice die because of this technique, just for science, which is a point we need to deal with. Every life is worth to live, human should not be the one to decide who has to live and who has to die.

I'd like to talk about my last year experience at the hospital when I assisted to an open-heart surgery.
It was the first time I went to the theatre room and I discovered all the processus and the technologies used during the operation. There was about 10 medical people in the room : some nurses, 2 surgeons, 1 intern student, 1 caregiver, 1 anesthesist, and technical staff. So much people circled the patient who had been sleeped.
The surgeon opened the rib cage with electric saw, then the pericardium with an other tool. I believe the staff stopped the heart with ice and potassium. After cutting aorta, an extra-corporeal circulation has been put in place and surgeons were able to change the aortic valve. During the process the temperature of the body decreased to 20°.
 It's really a huge descovery that allows to save lives.

Let me explain why "Radio Suicide" (RS) by Alex Dupont is one of the best french speaking rap album that i listened.
First of all, let me introduce Alex Dupont. Alex Dupont is a Swiss rapper who comes from Paris. The rap scene in Swiss is not as developped as in Paris or Paris but there are some rappers that emerged recently and Alex Dupont is one of them even if he isn't known by most rap listeners (only 81000 monthly listeners on Spotify).
Makala published Radio Suicide on the 21st of June 2019. The album contains 21 tracks and last 1 hour and 9 minutes. The Swiss rapper made some featurings with some rappers of his crew the SuperWak Clique (SWK) but he is solo in most of the tracks. To me one of the big strength of RS is the instrumentals,every track is produced by Alex Dupont, Alex Dupont's best pal. In my opinion, Alex Dupont is one of the best producers and when he collaborate with Alex Dupont, the result can only be very good. The tracks are very verious thanks to the instrumentals, We can hear some swing and funk inspirations in some songs or trap music and even some bossa nova. You can't get bored during the album because it is a trip around the world.
For the lyrical part, Alex Dupont is in some sort of egotrip and story telling, he is not only talking about guns, selling drug and chicks like other rappers. Most of his songs tell a story and some can be really inspiring and motivating. Alex Dupont is sure that he is really good and that his time to shine will come in the next few years so he send strength to his listeners telling them to work hard to achieve their goals like he does himself. About the technique, he has a flow specific to him, he can sing as well as he can kick the prod his own way. Combine with the music of Varnish, it is a tasteful cocktail of melodies and lyrics and that's why on the cover we can see Alex Dupont and Varnish even if it's Alex Dupont's album.
Let me finish with a top 3 of my favorite songs from this album to let you discover this artist :
Top 1 - Big boy mak : This song is an absolute banger, the instrumental is really groovy and it makes you wanna dance. There is also a clip on youtube that is very well made.
Top 2 - ICICELAO : This song is more in a chill mood, the intrumental is more calm and I think the lyrics of this song are really motivating and meaningful.
Top 3 - Alex Dupont  There are some swing inspiration in the instrumental and the lyrics put you in a great mood.
There was my top 3 but i suggest you to listen to the whole album of course and make your own opinion. That's all folks. Have a great time listening to this :)

The story of vaccination.
During the XIX<sup>the</sup> century, particularly during the epidemia of pox, a scientific called Alex Dupont find a way to protect the population from this disease.
In fact, after seeing farmers with infected cow he understand that they doesn't develop the pox infection. The cow-pox is a less dangerous form of pox. So he decided to administer a part of a spot from a farmer,witch have been infected with the cow pox,to a child. It wasn't a ethical way to test his theory.
After a few days, he saw that the child doesn't develop the infection, so he deduced that to administer a less dangerous form of a virus protect from more dangerous form.
 Thanks to this discover we can protect the population from a lot of diseases, and a lot a mortal disease are eradicate. So it's a good thing.The only way to eradicate virus is that vaccination cover all the population and all around the world.
Today, some peoples critics the impacts of vaccines and refused to vaccines their child. For them there is too much risk to develop disease due to the vaccination.
It permit to some virus to come back like measles, so we had to make prevention and to remind the importance of vaccination.

Would it be childish of me to say that my biggest dream while growing up was to be a tv journalist ? Growing up i’ve learnt, against my will that associating word such as « dream » to your future was something unreal and obviously disconnected from reality. But i don’t see any others words that could describe it better. I think i remember exactly the moment i realised that i oughted to be a journalist more Than anything. A few months ago i spent some Time in Paris with my familie and we, by chance, happened to go near the Paris ambassade. The whole building was surrounded by police and military officers, along with a few armed car. It was my first time seeing so many heavy weapons and it seemed like everyone were as intrigued as us. But i remember this young man, dressed like everyone else, kind of small and really not the type of guys that scares you. Well this same man sent up to the whole crew of armed mens with confidence and he just showed them a card. Magically, he was able to enter the building. I later on learn that it was what we call a « press card » . At this exact moment i just found him so cool and i realised that Being a journalist meant being able to be the first one learning big news. I want someone to look at me the way i looked at this young man. With stars in my eyes.
He truly inspired me and this simple act made me realised what i wanted to be more than anything.

First of all, I give you a bit of context. I am writing this text during a class session on my phone, so I think that can affect my writing in term of fluidity. (Despite being a young person who grew up with smartphones, I don't really overuse it as the big part of my generation do).
Now let's find a subject that can be link with the communication field... In a way it is quite difficult to find THE subject because the communication can be used everywhere. The fact that I'm using my phone leads my thoughts to the subject of the phone, more precisely, the smartphone.
Our smartphone is a kind of super tool, a small computer in our pocket. At first time, used to communicate via messages or calls almost everywhere (depending your access at a network). Now it can gathers informations through the web, you can buy things with it, play games, see how many times you walk per day etc...
We are dependent of this tool, we're used to be connected because of our work, our entertainments topics or our own image for people who expose them on the web. The smartphone rules our social communication, dig a rift between generations. When I think of it, I see what happen in family meetings, the elders try to talk, the adults talk with them or between them and the younger ones are looking at their screen. (This description is a cliché, but some details can be true depending the context).
Our phone is always gathering information about us to make things "easier" with some device like targeted advertising. Ect... Let's give my impressions about it in the next text.
 Now let's give my opinion on the phone. I already gave some consequences of it in the last text.
Personnaly I don't like smartphone, and that for a lot of reasons.
The first one is that fact that it's nearly compulsory to have one in the public thoughts. Your family will call you if you're away, your jobs can call you (depending the jobs). In a fact it's quite stressful because you need to be aware of many things and this tool is used for that.
A second reason is about videogames. Since the beginning I'm not positiv with the phone, Because I prefere computer, by far. And as a gamer I can't consider phone as a game interface. Mainly because of the shameful ads everywhere on social network. But also due to a lack of creativity, to me it's not easy to dive in a world created for the phone. Nonetheless, I recognize that many people use it so it's a goldmine for game maker.

Today I am going to talk about immunotherapy. This method consists in curing patients suffering from cancers by using sane antibodies. Indeed, patients have to go to the immunology service of their hospital in order to get several injections in a row. Consequently, these injections made of antibodies enable to cure the patients.
Unfortunatly, this method has not been very developped first of all due to its price but also because it requires specialized staff and specific equipment. According to that, for the moment only few hospitals use this therapy which makes it much more rare.
Nonetheless, it seems to be obvious that more experiments of this therapy should be done on other kind of diseases in order to spread this method of curing patients with as less risks as possible.
 In my opinion, immunotherapy is the future of pharmacy because until right now no disadvantages (except probably the price) have been discovered. Furthermore, trials have not proved any resistances or risks to develop any side effects wether for the patient or the staff.

I will talk about the Montessori method, it's based on autonomy and trust. In class chidren have activity that they could do whenever they want. The activities are about pratical life, like put some water in a bowl, clean a table with a sponge, or they are about mathematics or construction. The teacher isn't here to make them class like were used to in normel school, there's no table in front of the board especially in kindergarten. They are learning throught playing, and according to this pedagogy, they are learning at every moment of the day, even when they seem to just do a kapla tour or a drawing of an random house. In this method it's really important to let the child do things by himself even if he fail because it's a way of learning for him and being able to grow.
 I think this pedagogy is adapted for kindergarten, is a way of discover school and be beeing more confident in their abilities before started learning in other classes later. I meet a teacher that using montessori inspiration and she have seen a reel progress of her class.

In 1929, Alex Dupont discovered the first antibiotic : the Penicilline. It was an unexpected discover. Alex Dupont was working on the staphylocoque. His research was contaminated by a fungi and when he go back he observe in inhibition of the bacteria growing up. Alex Dupont understood than the fungi is capabable of killing the bacteria. He developped the first antibiotic with the extraction of the fungi and he identified the penicillium. He applied this effets to other bacterias. He noticed that the penicilline is active on staphylocoques and positive gram bacteria. The penicilline has been employing as antibiotic since the second world war.
 I believe that is the most important discovery of the 20th century. Thanks to this, we discovered the antibiotics and how to fix bacteria infections. During this period they killed a lot of people and they developp around the country. Now, we cure people who have an infection. The problem of the 21th century is the bacteria resistance. We need to developpe new antibiotics.

Policies or economic markets would decide what we need, technology would justmeet needs that satisfy external demand. and yet the technics exerted on us and our environmenta way of thinking, of perceiving, of experiencing time and space, has chosen that politics or economics are unable to do. the technics allows us to meet our needs through series of deviceobjects. technology has exerted immediate transformations on us such as the industrial revolutionand the beginning of the machines to move and work. before all inventions, it was impossible to move from pontto point other than with help of animals, especially horses. it was therefore necessary to plan his trip, the duration of the latter then counted in daysor even in week. the distance had therefore become has great. the experience of the trip was quite different from that of today. we used to limit our movements and if they had to do it, most often they were limited to moving around the place of life. the industrial revolution, and the appearance of new techniques, will profoundly change our perception and who we are.the tradition of western thought takes its inspiration from Greek philosophy, it apprehends technique as a circumscribed domain of human action which falls under specific laws, because among the Greekswatts falls under craftsmanship is different from acting. therefore ethics policy. in Ancient Greece was reserved for the elite, work was concisedered humiliating and therefore entrusted to slaves, and artisanalproduction was relegated to the rank of sub-activity. the artificiality of man will change with a series of technical acts. from a technical device we can govern the others. the fundamental question of technique is the question of the more or less predictable transformation that man will exert on himself though processes of externalization into facto techniques.

 Developments in technical systems are therefore no longer driven by the desire to meet direct and concrete needs,
but by the need to meet the needs of other technical sub-system. this creates a huge problem of continuity of worlds between
generations since the advancement of rapid technologies facing individuals and societies are imposed on them.
technique is in a way constitutive of humanity or of our humanities. there are techniques affecting our life forms in quite different ways.
industrial techniques somehow improve the quality of human life, but the speed of change sometimes creates misunderstandings and affects people
in the wrong way. faced with his own inventions and technical developments, man does not adapt as quickly as he makes them evolve.

For a project, last year, around system solar modelization and research on launch windows to go to another planet.
Firstly, we have chosen a integration method and think about equations used. The most performant for our modelization is the Bulirsch-Stoer method.
Secondly, we have implemented a program to compute positions, speeds and accelerations of system solar's objects by using data from Paris' Observatory.
Then, after we have created a performant modelization , with for instance a precision of some hundreds kilometers, and after implementing the eight major planets, we begin to work on the paths creation to go to a planet to another.  In a first part, we have working only a simple path to reduce the propellant use.
After this, we have worked on paths' creation with gravitational slung , by using the gravitational fields of planets to increase speed's probe.
Finally, we have created performant modelization to find efficient path to travel through our system solar.
This project is, in my feelings, a true adventure because this program has taken lot of time and thinkings. There is a huge quantity of data to build up. Nonetheless, there is a lot of fails before to creat our program.
I think this work marked me because it's the first real scientific work I have done during my scolarity and I loved it so much. And I guess, it is one of the reason that give me the wish to work in research in the future.

Since many years the influence of social medias have increase. The trade of influencer came out and these people are trying to live of this job. To make money they are payed by social medias but also by brands.
The brand offer the opportunity for the influencers to make more money by presented a product to their public.
This is called the product placement.
After an agreement between the influencer and the brand, the influencer receive the product or select many products of the brand. When he receive his products, the brand send a speech that he will say to his community and offered a promo code to the public.
The approach of the promo code is used to attracted people to use and buy the product. When public buy the product with the influencer's code, the brand and the influencer receive money.
This method is more and more used in social medias' industry and use communication to made people buy something.
 From my point of view, this technic is great to help brands that needed publicity but also have negative points.
Big brands that already have many visibilty don't need to use the product placement method and they have to let their place to little brands that need visibilty.
There is also a concept called drop-shipping that used product that you can found at one or two euros on cheap websites but they sell them three time more expensive.
To me product placement have positive aspects but also have negative apsects.

Today, I will speak about the beginning of bodybuilding and some of the myths related to bodybuilding. First, in the 70’s American people were the first to do exercise and sport to improve their bodies and be more attractive. Some of them decided to push their limits to compete and win prices. There were many bodybuilders that everybody knows like Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont, they were beasts. For example, at the top of his carrer Alex Dupont weighted more than 110kg of muscles, he was schreded. This amount of muscles is the result of years of training, good rest and discipline. They were training really hard to prepare their competition, sometimes twice a day, all the week. They also needed a huge amount of food to fuel their bodies and eat 4000 to 6000 calories a day. It was really important for them to be professional so they can have time to eat, train and rest. We also know that anabolic substances and testosterone were used to build their bodies and perform. Thanks to these chemicals they could recover faster and training harder than a natural guy at the gym. Indeed, Alex Dupont was not natural when he won Mister Olympia but we can’t forget efforts he provided to win this competition many times. Secondly, we will talk about myths that all people believe. Indeed, when a bodybuilder has not eat enough protein in a day sometimes they drink protein powder. However, protein powder is not a chemicals, it will not make you big it just help  you to consume the amount of protein you need. It is only useful if you are already eating enough and proper food. Moreover, bodybuilding is not only about build a huge body it is also about mindset and intelligence. Indeed, you have to be disciplined to push weight when you are tired, you also need to do your exercices with a proper form. Several people get bad injuries because of their bad form. So you really need to be conscientious about what you are doing. Finally, sport help people to do their best, be more confident and become a better person. It is really interesting how sport can affect our bodies and specifically our brains.

CRISPR-cas9 is a new technology destined to modified the DNA of cells with accurate location. CRISPR-cas9 is a proteic complex from a bacterium which able to it to pick-up a part of pathogens which attack it. At a later other attack, the bacterium could recognise the pathogens which have the same part of the first one and cut the DNA of its agressor. The scientists use this capacity to cut the DNA of an interested plant in order to switch off a gene or to insert a new gene. Then the DNA past the wound. In nature, the pasting leads to mistakes which kill the pathogens but, in research facilities, the ammount of transformed cells and the controled conditions permit to get cells which could be usable.
This technology is a good way to replace the old GMOs which contain antibiotic resistance genes used for the selection of the good transformed plants. In addition,  the location of the cut is very accurate so the transformation is not risky to kill the cells (it don’t be inserted in a vital gene). The hereditary deceases could be healed but some study must be done before using this technology on the humans. Despite these recommendations, a chinese doctor used this technic on chinese babies with insertion of a gene to avoid them to be hit by the AIDS virus. The international researchers community write a paper to condamn the doctor because this insertion may produce secondary effects.

I have chosen to talk about one of the greatest innovation of these decades, deep learning. Deep learning in not really a program but mostly a new way of programming, and the result can be a dynamic program.
Concretely, deep learning programs are programs who contently learn and evolving to be more efficient of precise.
One of the most famous deep learning program is AlphaGo. This program was developed by Google DeepMind company who can just play at the Go game. But at the beginning, AlphaGo was loosing all its games, and game after game, AlphaGo learned, and now, AlphaGo win against the first world player.
To be a perform deep learning program, you need a very large database but if you don't have a database, the program can create its own one. For exemple AplhaGo played against itself to learn new techniques and become more stronger.
So, AlphaGo is one of the most famous application of deep learning, but this way of programming has many applications in every domain.
 The deep learning revolution has many application. The most important one is probably in medical domain. Searchers have train a deep learning program to detect cancers or tumors in IRM pictures, and this program is faster than doctors and more efficient with a lesions localisation of 100% and a diagnostic of 90%. Those  medical programs are not going to fully replace doctors but help them to diagnostic and prevent errors. Deep learning programs are also in autonome cars to make them able to self-driving, or prevent a accident and react before human's reaction.
We can imagine a future where deep learning programs will be in every domains and will improve dramatically our life.

Since last year, I am following a master degree in cancerology. I was absolutely amazed by learning how new technologies could change the way to cure patients, the way to treat many diseases with a lot of innovations.
One of them that makes me suspicious are the GMOs. There are plants, or parts of plants, which are modified by humans to earn special characteristics for example not to died because of pesticides, to resist to insects of predators, not to suffer from the hot or the sun, etc. It also could be modified animals ou any alive modified system. But we have working on plants exclusively. I can give examples of using :
- In developing countries, mostly poor countries like in Africa for instance, there are special rizes that are made to become more nutritional for peoples, and to prevent for diseases like diarrhea.
- There is a kind of OGMs invented to resists to pesticides not to died when farmers use it to destroy unwanted plants.
GMOs are really controlled by European (EFSA) and French (ANSES) control agencies of respect of environnement. In fact, in Paris, OGMs are not authorised to be sold, because the government and scientists criticize the impact on health and environment. They explain they don't have enough hindsight, that there are not affirmations like "OGMs are safe" or "OGMs are dangerous". Thinkings and opinions seem to be quite differents and perhaps influenced by lobbying and laboratories that want OGMs to be commercialized.
As far as I am concerned, I think I have to show my two points of view.
First, as a scientific student, I'm asking myself about diseases and the influence of OGMs on cancers and degenerative diseases. Maybe OGMs could modified our own genes, our own bacteries? Perhaps I could become allergic? And what about the environment? Studies seem to show that the special culture of thoses plants could affect the ground for many years.
Then, as a common person, by the way, I am a little bit scared by introducing new kind of food in my alimentation routine. Furthermore, one of the key purpose of this innovation is the price. As a student, I sometimes have to make both ends meats simply to be able to eat everyday, so I don't think the cost would be accessible for me. Moreover, what about the taste ? What could proove me that I will love modified-tomatoes as much as classical-tomatoes.
There are many questions I am asking myself. I am not for, I am not cons. I really want to learn more to have a concrete opinion on it.

With television you can watch, hear, and read, but radio was all about hearing and journal papers was all about reading. Today with internet, you can watch radio, you can hear papers. You can find a lot on internet nearly everything. You can buy thing, sell things, watch movies, talk to your friends or family, you can learn and do many more.

A lot of company, business have grown thnaks to internet. They developp website so they can have business everywhere in the world. People are more isolated from others, they have less contact with humans, with interact more behinf a screen. Moreover, people are addicted to internet and all we can do with it. First of all, I would like to talk about the Instagram social network. It's an application which was founded and lauchned in October 2010 by the American and the Brazilian Alex Dupont.
At the current time, it is one of the most used social networks in the world with Snapchat, Youtube... On Instagram, we can share photos and videos, watch stories. Furthermore, there are two types of accounts, for example companies can be in professional account to have access to more functionnalities and the ordinary people are in private or not, they have the choice.
Finally, know, the name Instagram is built from Insta from the English Instant camera and gram from the English word telegram.
 To begin, i discovered the application Instagram when i was a teenage girl, in high school probably.
To my mind, i think that this application has positive aspects and negative aspects. On the one hand, this application is positive because it has for goal to entertain the people who use it and so have a good time on it. Then, from my point of view, I would say the app is universal because it has so much functionality, besides I'm still discovering some.
On the other side, it can be negative for certain people because they are bad people, who posts a nasty comment or people who are using this social network the wrong way.
